title: Drawing, Project for a Fountain Group/For the Grand Trianon at Versailles 1766, ca. 1766
title_raw: Project for a Fountain Group/For the Grand Trianon at Versailles 1766
medium: Graphite, pen, brush and wash with black ink on laid paper
inscribed:
Written in ink, bottom of design: "Cuvillies invenit et s(i)ecit, 1766 le Grand dragon."

Reverse: "acheté a Lyon/mai 1907."
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description:
The sculptured group of a fountain is shown against a paved terrace with some plans at right. The water pours from the eyes and the mouth of a sea monster to which two mermen cling. 

Reverse: a part of a plant ornament; graphite.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Project for a Fountain Group/For the Grand Trianon at Versailles 1766, ca. 1766. Graphite, pen, brush and wash with black ink on laid paper. 
Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-27
